thread.title: Marine Le Pen is 'the ONLY force' who can pull France out of EU, claims niece Marion
thread.title_full: Marine Le Pen is 'the ONLY force' who can pull France out of EU, claims niece Marion

title: Marine Le Pen is 'the ONLY force' who can pull France out of EU, claims niece Marion
text:
GETTY Marion Le Pen is also a politician for the National Front 
She added that "there are no other candidates" supporting the ideas of her aunt, who can boast “a potential possibility to take part in at least the first round" of the French presidential elections. 
Marion claimed that “drastically limiting immigration” was among one of the key points of Marine’s program. 
Among the key policies would be to “get out of Schengen, regain control of our borders and know who goes in and out” and also have an “extremely tough policy” on radical Islamists. 
The National Front party would seek to “deport the radical imams” and shut down “all organisations that are in touch with radical Islam”. 
Marion also blasted presidential frontrunner Emmanuel Macron for failing to present a coherent idea of what he would do if elected – unlike Marine who outlined has consistently outlined her plans. 
She told RT: “Emmanuel Macron has no wish at all to question the core idea of European federalism, the idea of European government, the eurozone and the Schengen zone. 
"It's a great talent of Emmanuel Macron to create an imitation of a program, which is in fact based on total emptiness. His program is a real marketing product, said to be something new, but in fact he's been doing the same thing since he was a minister in the Manuel Valls government. Marion Le Pen in pictures Wed, July 27, 2016 The niece of French far-right leader Marine Le Pen has joined the military reserve and has urged "young patriots" to follow in her footsteps, take a look through her career to date, AFP/Getty Images 1 of 12 French far right Front National (National Front - FN) party's Parliament member and candidate for the regional elections in the Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur (PACA) GETTY Marine Le Pen launched her presidential campaign on Sunday 
“I honestly think he will not succeed in converting his purely marketing product into electoral votes.” 
“I also think that he stands for protecting immigration, and thus is against expectations of the majority of the French people.” 
Marine Le Pen is the among the favourites in the first round of elections in April after Francois Fillon has become embroiled in a corruption allegations alongside his wife. Related articles
